title: Rhino 8 Grasshopper Script Editor - Design Feedback
question:
Hi 
@eirannejad
,


Congrats on the progress of the Rhino 8 Grasshopper Script Editor. It looks a lot sharper than last time I had a go. That said, I do find there are design issues where the current GHPython editor shines brighter. Notably:


1: Wasted Screen Space + Visually Busy/Cluttered


With the same window  and output/terminal size, there is substantially less space for the actual code editor:


2023-08-01 11_04_12-Grasshopper - unnamed
1564×1030 61.6 KB


This might be improved by making these two menus hideable/toggleable:


2023-08-01 11_05_20-Grasshopper Python Script Editor
1564×1030 60.1 KB


And by getting rid of this tab bar, which I don’t think currently have functionality (does it?):


2023-08-01 11_06_43-Grasshopper Python Script Editor
1564×1030 59.5 KB


And by moving this information/buttons down to the bottom menu bar:


2023-08-01 11_29_01-Grasshopper Python Script Editor
1564×1030 76.9 KB


2: Clunky/Wasteful Language Indicator:


As mentioned 
elsewhere
, this language indicator is pretty clunky/wasteful. The information is also provided two places inside the editor and may be provided on the component itself by swapping out the icon to respectively the C#, CPython and IronPython logos upon language selection:


2023-08-01 11_39_27-Grasshopper - unnamed
1564×1030 104 KB


3: Keyboard Shortcuts


I understand that there is new functionality planned (e.g. debugging). But changing the 
10+ year old
 
Test
 shortcut (i.e. F5) is pretty jarring. Perhaps consider making 
Run
 F5 and 
Continue
 F6:


2023-08-01 11_09_09-Grasshopper Python Script Editor
1564×1030 63.3 KB


2023-08-01 11_08_56-
1564×1030 65.1 KB


4: Syntax Highlighting


There are quite a few issues here, I assume these are just the result of whatever the new editor is built upon. But anywho here are a couple of the ones that immediately sprang to mind for me:


2023-08-01 11_14_51-Grasshopper Python Script Editor
1564×1030 79.5 KB
